resources.string: "Hey Riker… take the cart to Fallowhill Farm and load up on whatever food and supplies you can find. The commoners of Oxboro deserve a break."
[Upon closer inspection, there is a bloodstain on the letter and you hear the sound of a wolf howling not so far away. It seems someone else will need to collect supplies.]
Where has<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" /> Riker gotten off to? The man best not be in the belly of some beast. He gets so cranky when he dies.
"Hey Riker… take the cart to Fallowhill Farm and load up on whatever food and supplies you can find. The commoners of Oxboro deserve a break."
"Oh… and watch out for the wolves out that way. They're vicious and just ravenous enough that you'll look like a tasty morsel. Good Luck, Survivalist Lee"
No Good Deed
Recover the supplies described in Huntsman Lee's requisition note and discover the fate of his porter, Riker.
"What happened to Riker…"
[Upon closer inspection, there is a bloodstain on the letter and you hear the sound of a wolf howling not so far away. It seems someone else will need to collect supplies.]
"Hey Riker… take the cart to Fallowhill Farm and load up on whatever food and supplies you can find. The commoners of Oxboro deserve a break."
Oi,<g id="male_complimentplayer" /> you're not Riker. Better looking than that old horse-faced lout, you are.
But look<g id="male_complimentplayer" /> at what you bring! The people of the settlement need this food more than ever.
Recover Corn from the Withered
Follow the wolf tracks to find Riker
Defeat Wolves
Recover Riker's pack
"Hey Riker… take the cart to Fallowhill Farm and load up on whatever food and supplies you can find. The commoners of Oxboro deserve a break."
"Oh… and watch out for the wolves out that way. They're vicious and just ravenous enough that you'll look like a tasty morsel. Good Luck, Survivalist Lee"
You've done<g id="male_complimentplayer" /> us a great turn, getting more sustenance into the settlement. The gap between the rich and the poor grows steady here in Everfall.
As for<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" /> the rich, though, the noble families…
Fine Furs For Fine Folk
Acquire Midnight Hides from Midnight Den to replicate Huntsman Lee's fancy jacket for inquiring noble families.
"Who are the noble families?"
There's old<g id="male_explain" /> money, the Publius, Sharma, and Ayad families, and then there's new money with the Sacco and Ou families.
They run<g id="male_explain" /> this town with their coin, and have plenty to spare.
"How do we get them to spare it?"
Well, the rich<g id="male_nodProud" /> fancy their fashions. The finer, the better.
The hides<g id="male_nodProud" /> of Midnight Wolves are highly prized. If you could acquire some from their den, I could turn them into fine coats. We'd share the profits, of course.
After doing<g id="male_explain" /> your good deed for the day, it's only fitting you help yourself out, too.
Ah, just<g id="male_smile" /> feel how plush these pelts are! They're bloody perfect.
The noble<g id="male_smile" /> families will be happy as a rabbit in a carrot field. Nice doing business with you, friend!
Seek fine furs at the Midnight Den
Slay Midnight Wolves in search of quality furs
The nobles<g id="male_smile" /> are loving those fur coats! Next thing you know, they'll be asking about my fancy trousers.
Who doesn't<g id="male_nodProud" /> want to strike as fine a figure as Huntsman Lee?
I have not<g id="female_beckon" /> seen your face around Everfall before. Tread carefully, adventurer. Danger lurks outside of the settlement.
Hmm,<g id="female_beckon" /> I have not seen your face around Everfall before. Tread carefully, adventurer. Danger lurks outside of the settlement.
Hmm, it<g id="female_nodding" /> is fortuitous we've run into each other again. Tread carefully, adventurer. Danger lurks outside of the settlement.
Canary in the Corrupted Mine
Scout the land of Canary Mine to investigate the Corrupted threat.
"What kind of danger?"
The kind<g id="female_nodding" /> that can take what you value most, so you best keep your wits about you.
Then again,<g id="female_nodding" /> you seem to be more aware of the danger that menaces us.
"Are you talking about Corruption?"
Yes.<g id="female_nodding" /> That vile, despicable evil, spreading without end.
Canary Mine<g id="female_nodding" /> is swarming with the wretches, who need to be put down. I happen to have some poison in my possession. If you sow it on their lands, they will suffer.
I have<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> been developing this poison ever since… Well, I shall not burden you with a sob story when we've only just become acquainted.
The earth<g id="female_rightfistThreaten" /> of Canary Mine will yield no more for the Corrupted. Good. Let them starve. Let them feel the sting of privation.
Travel to {POITags}
Scout South Vantage Point
Scout Opening of Cave
Scout North Vantage Point
Defeat {targetName}
I assume<g id="female_thinking" /> you informed the Captain of the Guard about the Corruption, and he did nothing?
Typical.<g id="female_thinking" /> Everfall is blind to anything that doesn't glitter.
I assume<g id="female_thinking" /> you informed the Captain of the Guard about the Corruption, and he did nothing?
Typical.<g id="female_thinking" /> Everfall is blind to anything that doesn't glitter.
Salting the Earth
Poison the earth of Ebonrock Cavern and Ebonrock Quarry while taking down as many Corrupted as you can for Tekla Petrowski.
"Nobody seems to believe me."
Then they<g id="female_disappointed" /> are fools. Corruption is real, it is here, and it will take so much more from us than we could ever expect.
I've stared<g id="female_smackfist" /> into the face of that evil. I know what must be done.
"I'm all ears."
<g id="female_order" />Take the poison to Ebonrock Cavern and Ebonrock Quarry. Seed it in the earth, as you did before.
We don't<g id="female_nodding" /> have the strength to reclaim those places, but<g id="female_smackfist" /> I'll be damned before I let the Corrupted use them.
The quarry<g id="female_nodding" /> and cavern used to be some of the most prosperous mines in Everfall.
It is done.<g id="female_nodding" /> All my poison has been used, and it will take months to create a new batch.
I thought…<g id="female_disappointed" /> I thought it would quell the rage, but I don't feel any different.
"I'm a bit worried about you."
Spare me your pity.<g id="female_disappointed" /> I dispensed with pity long ago, for myself, and for the Corrupted. There's no place for it in this cruel world.
Travel to {POITags}
Travel to {POITags}
Poison the soil within Ebonrock Cavern
Poison the soil of Ebonrock Quarry
If you're<g id="female_nodding" /> still keen on destroying Corruption, go back to the settlement and update Huntsman Lee with our progress.
He will<g id="female_nodding" /> want to know what we've done.
Tekla's Tragedy
Venture to the Everfall Settlement to discuss the Corrupted incursion with Huntsman Odnell Lee.
"Why talk to Lee?"
Odnell Lee<g id="female_nodding" /> is a friend. He may play every political side in Everfall, but he has proven trustworthy when it counts. Go speak to him.
We used<g id="female_nodding" /> to be closer, Lee and I. That was when… Nevermind.
Wait… <g id="male_whattheheckBig" />you're saying that Tekla did what to the mines?! Oh, my… I have a terrible feeling this is about Audrey.
"Who is Audrey?"
Audrey Kelleher<g id="male_think" /> of Kelleher Farmstead. She and Tekla were close. Closer than close, really…
They were<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> together, until Audrey was killed by Corrupted and just… never came back. Poor Tekla still visits the farmstead, haunting it like a ghost.
Speak to Huntsman Lee in Oxboro
These foul<g id="female_smackfist" /> Corrupted will suffer as I have. I'm sure they can still feel pain. I'm sure they can howl with anguish.
These foul<g id="female_smackfist" /> Corrupted will suffer as I have. I'm sure they can still feel pain. I'm sure they can howl with anguish.
Avenging Audrey
Shame the Corrupted forces occupying Kelleher's Farmstead by taking out the Lieutenants and speak to Tekla Petrowski.
"This is about Audrey."
So, Lee<g id="female_disappointed" /> told you about Audrey… Yes, this is for her. She was killed in her own home and never came back.
I don't<g id="female_disappointed" /> know why this happened, only that it forever changed the trajectory of my life.
"What happened?"
I searched<g id="female_disappointed" /> for weeks, but she never returned to me, and no one could find any trace of her.
Defeating<g id="female_disappointed" /> the Corrupted that did this to her won't bring her back, but I<g id="female_smackfist" /> don't care. I want those monsters to feel even a sliver of my pain.
Audrey<g id="female_disappointed" /> was too good for this island. Too good for this world.
So the<g id="female_smackfist" /> lieutenants have been defeated. Good. They deserve much worse, but this will suffice for now.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Audrey, every day that passes without you, I feel myself growing more hollow.
I only hope I can remember you should I succumb to that despair.
[Before you lies a locket with the initials 'TP+AK' expertly carved into it.]
Bittersweet Memory
Return the Lost Locket to Tekla Petrowski.
"Tekla would want this."
[You pocket the locket with the intent of showing it to Tekla Petrowski.]
[The locket is dusty and lonely. Perhaps it will find a new home with Tekla Petrowski.]
What are<g id="female_lookforwardWonder" /> you holding? Could it be…? I thought the locket was lost forever. <g id="female_sobbing" />Thank you for finding it. Oh, my Audrey...
Travel to {POITags}
[You've retrieved the locket that once lay here for Tekla Petrowski.]
That locket<g id="female_crying" /> reminds me of happier days.
Days when<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> we would go to Meadowlake Fishery to gather her favorite flowers, and watch the sun set across the water...
The Lovers' Flowers
Touched by your return of the locket, Tekla Petrowski wishes for you to gather a bouquet of Meadowlake Flowers at Meadowlake Fishery to remember Audrey.
"Do you want to go there?"
No.<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> It is too painful. But if you find yourself heading in the direction of Meadowlake Fishery perhaps you could gather a bouquet for her? He he!
No matter<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> where she is, what became of her… I think Audrey would like that.
I have<g id="female_nodding" /> already asked so much of you, but here I am, asking for the tiniest bit of comfort.
Your willingness<g id="female_nodding" /> to help a stranger has taught me much.
It's not<g id="female_nodding" /> just about hating the Corrupted, it's about loving the living while you can.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect {itemName}
You have<g id="female_nodding" /> been a balm to my weary heart, {playerName}, but I…<g id="female_disappointed" /> I need some time alone.
Lee must<g id="female_nodding" /> be worried sick by now. You can go put his mind at ease.
Lee's Condolences
Relay what has happened with Tekla Petrowski to Odnell Lee in the Everfall Settlement.
"Are you going to be okay?"
Hmm…<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> Not today. But perhaps tomorrow, or the day after that.
You needn't<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> worry about me. You've done enough, and I promise not to forget your kindness.
Lee is<g id="female_nodding" /> a kind man, and he's fussed over me ever since I lost Audrey to the Corrupted.
You're back!<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" /> You must've done something incredible to soothe the tempest in Tekla's heart.
Losing Audrey<g id="male_wipetear" /> nearly destroyed her, and I felt so damn helpless watching it happen. Thank you. <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Because of you, I didn't lose another friend.
My soul<g id="female_nodding" /> feels less heavy, less prone to the madness of being Lost. Thank you again for all you've done for Audrey and me.
I can see that you're new to Aeternum. Strong arms, though--clearly a warrior.
I'm sure you have plenty of… whatever it is you do. Good day!
"The obelisks left behind by the Ancients seem to have multiple functions: drawing power, and using that power for some defensive purpose."
"I have recorded two particular towers of interest, Orion and Draco." -William Heron
"The obelisks left behind by the Ancients seem to have multiple functions: drawing power, and using that power for some defensive purpose."
"I have recorded two particular towers of interest, Orion and Draco." -William Heron
A Circle of Stars
Investigate towers Orion and Draco to acquire Ancient Devices, then return them with the notes to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement.
"This looks interesting."
[You spot a few hasty sketches in the margins, which appear to be diagrams of small Ancient devices.]
[This 'William Heron' might provide a decent reward for returning their notes and finding a few devices.]
Most of the content in these notes is esoteric and hard to understand. Only the directions to towers Orion and Draco are clear enough to follow.
Hmm? You don't look like an antiquarian. What business could you possibly have with--
Egads, my notes! And you're carrying some of those peculiar Ancient devices. Does this mean you visited the towers yourself?
"Yes. And you must be WH."
William Heron, gentleman antiquarian. Frankly, I'm astounded that you came to me at all.
The average adventuring sort would have pawned the whole lot.
Retrieve the Ancient Device
Search the tower Draco for another device
Retrieve the Ancient Device
[You have successfully reunited William Heron with his lost field notes.]
Since you are clearly no ordinary muscle for hire, would you be interested in collaborating with me?
Think about the possibilities. Your brawn, my brain, and a host of mysteries to solve.
Stellar Research
Investigate towers Perseus and Lupus, then return to William Heron to tell him what you found.
"I don't want to write papers."
Perish the thought! You'll handle anything in the field. We will both be credited on any works I write.
And of course, you will be compensated with coin and any… hmm… items that are irrelevant to my studies.
"You mean anything I find?"
I'm glad we have an understanding. Now, we will begin further field exploration with towers Perseus and Lupus.
The towers are named for constellations associated with ferocity and martial might. Be on your guard.
From what I can glean, the Ancients place neither sun nor earth at the center of creation. Hmm.
To them, the heavens are an endless void with no center. It's quite impossible to picture.
You look a bit worse for wear. I do apologize for sending you in blind.
I had no luck finding any records of either Perseus or Lupus, aside from some useless myths about celestial wolves. Ha.
"I was attacked by guardians."
As was I, when I first set out to solve this mystery. But<g id="male_think" /> defending what? Against whom?
And why go through the trouble of guarding inert blocks of stone? These are the questions that keep us antiquarians up at night.
Investigate the tower Perseus
Investigate the Ancient Device
Investigate the tower Lupus
Investigate the Ancient Device
Examine the Ancient Device
Defeat the enforcers
Let us assume that the Ancients were not wasteful in what they built.
Here's a tentative hypothesis: the towers only function when they are activated. The guardians merely deter intruders from tampering with them.
Beacons in the Dark
Investigate towers Norma, Leo, and Hercules and see if there is a way to activate them.
"Any idea how to activate them?"
Not particularly. I confess that at this point, you have more practical experience with the towers than I do.
I may need to promote you to co-author on my thesis at this rate.
I suspect that the skeletal guardians are unintelligent. Less like men, more like clockwork mindlessly ticking on.
Wait! Wait, wait, wait, wait. Your very presence caused the towers to glow?
Oh.There's no rhyme or reason to these damnable buildings! First the defenders attack you, but then the towers respond to you? I struggle to make sense of it.
Find a way to activate the tower Norma
Investigate the base of the obelisk
Investigate the north face
Investigate the south face
Activate the tower
Find a way to activate the tower Leo
Investigate the base of the obelisk
Investigate the north face
Investigate the south face
Activate the tower
Find a way to activate the tower Hercules
Investigate the base of the obelisk
Investigate the north face
Investigate the south face
Activate the tower
Meet William Heron near Fisherman's Bend
At the very least, lighting up the towers proves they have some active function.
They are more than mere monuments to the Ancients' power, and all my efforts haven't been a waste of time.
Towers in the earth, constellations above, a universe of endless void…
Something is missing... Some piece that I've carelessly overlooked. What is it?
Hmm. Perhaps it's time to try a different approach. Gather information from a different source.
What have you been doing with the Ancient guardians who try to attack you?
Azoth Awakening
Collect Azoth Dust from Ancient Guardians at towers Canus, Ursa, and Monoceros.
"Destroying them. Thoroughly."
… A predictable answer. The next time you destroy them, could you bring back samples from their remains?
"That sounds a bit gruesome."
Ugh. No need to be squeamish. They're little more than bones and animated Azoth, and it's the Azoth that interests me.
Try Canis, Ursa, and Monoceros towers. Their Ancient defenders are fresh and untested.
Surely you aren't put off by a few samples from long-dead skeletons? Hmm. Perhaps I could've phrased that better, now that I think about it…
This Azoth is only slightly contaminated with human bone dust. It will suffice.
These defenders must have been made for a special purpose, and the Azoth samples should illuminate that purpose.
Retrieve bone samples from Canis
Collect bone samples from Ancient Guardians
Retrieve bone samples from Ursa
Collect bone samples from Ancient Guardians
Retrieve bone samples from Monoceros
Collect bone samples from Ancient Guardians
Now, the moment of truth, when all my theories are put to the test.
Tell me, have you ever heard of an armillary sphere?
Constellation Convergence
Retrieve the Armillary Sphere from the Shattered Obelisk, along with Ancient Runekeys held by its defenders. Return them to William Heron, who hopes to unlock the Armillary Sphere.
"A model of the stars, right?"
Accurate, if simple. The Ancients employed them as well, though theirs were far more complex.
Between the astronomical names of each tower and my own prior research, I believe an armillary sphere is the key to reactivating the tower system.
"It might be heavily guarded."
It certainly will be, by the most powerful guardians.
The Azoth dust samples reveal different purposes for each guardian type. The ones who guard the armillary sphere will also hold the keys necessary for unlocking it.
I can only imagine what Aeternum looked like during the reign of the Ancients. I feel we would have gotten along swimmingly, don't you?
At last, the armillary sphere! I'll insert the keys, and… hmm. That's unexpected.
The good news is that I now know the purpose of the obelisks. They drew power from the heavens to protect the land against Corruption.
"And the bad news?"
The system is quite delicate.
It hasn't been functioning properly for hundreds of years. And our… enthusiastic investigation did not help matters.
"You mean we BROKE it?!"
Ah, that's an overstatement. I prefer to say we failed to repair the Corruption shield. And contributed to its deteriorated state.
Hah! The Ancients are long gone, yet they've taught me a sharp lesson in humility.
Locate the Armillary Sphere from the Shattered Obelisk
Defeat Ancient Guardians for keys to the Armillary Sphere
Retrieve the Armillary Sphere
It wasn't all in vain. With a working armillary sphere, I can start making sense of the Ancients' view of the heavens.
Or trying to, at any rate. It may take me several more lifetimes.

string.comment: (Plays after finishing Heron's quest and Everfall MSQ)
string.speaker: William Heron
string.name: WilliamHeron

resources.string: You are acquainted with that elderly chap, Yonas? He had some choice words about my "meddling" with the obelisk.

string.comment: (Plays after finishing Heron's quest and Everfall MSQ)
string.speaker: William Heron
string.name: WilliamHeron

resources.string: Who would have suspected he could shout with such force?
You've done so much for me and my research, friend.
You remind me of one of my former colleagues, Simon Grey. We had a bit of a rivalry, as you might imagine.
Based on the Foreman's Ledger you recovered, it's clear that the Amrine Excavation delved into an underground network of ruins that actually led to the Shattered Obelisk!
I knew there was more to that place!
Together, we have uncovered more insights into the Ancients than anyone else in Aeternum history.
Hear that, Simon Grey? Oh sorry, that's disrespectful, isn't it? But who cares? I don't!
Foreman's Ledger (Expedition)
Collect the Foreman's Ledger in Amrine Excavation. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"What happened to him?"
Simon led the expedition into the Amrine Excavation of Windsward many years ago, and never returned.
I still say the real genius behind Simon was his Foreman, who mapped every Ancient Ruin in all Aeternum.
"What happened to the Foreman?"
Who knows? He never returned from the Excavation either. I assume they're both dead... or worse.
Say though, if some bold soul such as yourself were to get me the Foreman's Ledger, I would offer a handsome reward.
The Amrine Excavation is a dangerous digsite, so you will likely need friends to safely explore it.
Is that it? His ledger? Fantastic! With this, I can learn a great deal!
Some of the notes he made here… fascinating. Who knew?
Venture Into {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Venture Into {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Starstone of Shattering (Expedition)
Collect the Starstone Diadem from Greundgul the Regent inside the Shattered Obelisk. Report back to William Heron in the Everfall Settlement when your task is complete.
"More to the Obelisk?"
Yes, the Foreman's notes suggest the existence of a side entrance that could actually allow a small group to get inside.
Can you imagine the secrets hidden in there? You must go there for me! You must!
"What do you expect to find?"
The ledger speaks of a Starstone Diadem, apparently an artifact from the Ancient ruling class.
The power of such a thing would only be surpassed by its value to my research. Recover the Diadem for me, and I will give you its equivalent in exchange.
Oh, the possibilities! We could be unearthing an artifact that helps us fight the Corrupted, or at the very least gives us insight into the Ancients.
This is truly a momentous find. This Starstone Diadem seems to have denoted an Ancient Guardian of incredibly high ranking, a ruler of some sort!
A regent, perhaps? Oh, I simply must get to studying it further.
Have you also come to laugh at me? It was an accident, I swear…
I've gone and spoiled everything, absolutely everything with my clumsiness. Have you also come to laugh at me?
Dishonorable Daughter
Venture into Arcturus to recover an item of equal value to the one Tamra Ayad destroyed in her home estate, and return the item to Tamra Ayad.
"Uh, no. Who's laughing at you?"
Everyone! After what I've done. In my clumsiness, I knocked over and shattered grandmother's favorite vase.
It was irreplaceable, a family heirloom from the old world. Now, I'm all alone…
"Alone?"
My family cannot tolerate such a misstep. They sent me to get something of equal value, or to never return home again.
There might be valuable relics in Arcturus, but I'm scared to death of the Guardians. Can you help?
Look for anything valuable, large, pristine, or beautiful. Going back to my family depends upon it. S-Sorry. No pressure…
Look at that, what a beauty! This will definitely get me back in grandmother's good graces! You've saved my life, friend.
But on second thought… I should make certain this is what I think it is.
"How do you intend to do that?"
Reading! I've always had my nose in dusty old books.
Hmm… maybe there's some opportunity in my earlier misfortune, and my hobbies will finally earn my family's respect! I'm off to find a scholar who can tell me more.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect an {itemName} from Ancient Guardians at Arcturus
This vase is even grander than the one I broke. Priceless, even.
And those fascinating symbols must mean something. They can't merely be decorative…
[A set of Ancient scrolls with indecipherable glyphs lies before you.]
[A set of Ancient scrolls with indecipherable glyphs lies before you. Perhaps an inquiring mind would be curious to their value?]
Curious Child
Bring the Ancient Scrolls to Tamra Ayad to assess their value.
"Tamra was looking for relics..."
[You pick up the writings and decide to bring them to Tamra Ayad, the woman who asked you to find a vase in Arcturus.]
[The scrolls sit waiting to be taken to someone who understands their value.]
What's this? More Ancient relics? Oh! Writings!
Grandmother won't appreciate these. They hardly draw the eye. But I'll find a better use for them than sitting in our manor, collecting dust.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect Ancient Scroll
Collect Ancient Scrolls
Just look at them, shoving tentpoles into the ground and tearing up the earth! Have they no respect for this ancient place?
Hello again, friend. Imagine meeting you here.
I found some antiquarians to help me assess the vase we found, and… well... they convinced me to join them. I'm working on some field studies here.
An Heir Transformed
Venture into the Varangian camp to recover the stolen Ancient relics for Tamra Ayad.
"You aren't bringing it back home?"
Not just the vase. I feel… this place better suits me. Finally, I can explore my own interests!
But that brings me to my purpose here. We've heard disturbing rumors about looters in the vicinity.
"You’re recovering what they stole?"
Not by myself! I'm of the more scholarly persuasion, so I was hoping you could do so for me.
I've seen yellow-garbed knights lurking around the edges of the ruins. They<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> should not be too hard to follow.
I doubt the knights will part with their finds willingly.
Oh my! You recovered so many! They must have been hoarding these like squirrels.
Ah, look at the damage they suffered. Such a shame, but they could still offer insights. I only wish…
"You wish your family could see it?"
Wishing won't open their eyes. They care for only wealth and status, and I am not a child any more.
Falling short of my family's demands may have been for the best, in the end. For that, I owe you my deepest thanks.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat Vorongard Knights for {itemName}s
Without your aid, I never would've had the courage to pursue my true passion.
Perhaps with the passage of time, my family will finally understand what they have overlooked all these years. I am my own person.
I do wonder if I should go back to the family manor. Send a note?
But if they were truly worried about me, surely they would not have exiled me over a broken vase!
Unless you intend to risk life and limb for the sake of sport, I suggest you keep an eye out for bears. They wander this stretch of forest.
You, there! Ever been mauled?

Ha ha ha ha! Death escapes us on this island, so why not go up against a bear? Can you<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> prove yourself tough enough to withstand the razor sharp teeth and claws of a killer?
Ever Been Mauled?
Felix Livius challenges you to "wrestle" a bear for the raw thrill of it all.
"Have YOU ever been mauled?"
Almost every day! It's a great way to wake yourself up, squaring up with a fuzzy behemoth of nature.
Doesn't even hurt after awhile. All I can feel when I bring a beast down is the sting of victory.
"Sure. Where's the nearest bear?"
Ha ha! Yes, that's the spirit! There is one who patrols his territory northwest of here, and he's a fearsome bugger.
So, what are you waiting for? Get out there and have the battle of your immortal life!
Still hanging around here? You ought to be wrestling a bear, and we both know it. Scared?
Haha! You've done it! Good for you, showing some true brawn.
Next time? Try fighting it with no weapons at all. Bare fists versus bear fists. <g id="male_laughCocky" />Ha ha ha! You'll never know a sweeter victory.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Ha ha! The second best part of being mauled, right after the thrill, is the bragging rights! You know who this will really impress? Huntsman Lee.
Odnell's an odd man but he appreciates a lurid story.
Bragging Rights
Talk to Huntsman Lee in the Everfall Settlement about your bear experience.
"You're one to talk about 'odd'.'"
Ha ha! I'm just an enthusiast. Odnell, though? Cares too much about appearances. But Aeternum's full of all sorts.
Go tell him you defeated a bear, and he'll make sure everyone in Oxboro knows it.
Lost, are we? Huntsman Lee is in Oxboro, so he shouldn't be too hard to find. Go report your victory!
You did<g id="male_whattheheckBig" /> what, with a WHAT?! A bear! Now, that takes serious guts. Did you wind up spilling yours in the fight?
"You're keen on the gory details."
You bet! Good news<g id="male_goodnews" /> is sparse these days. Tell me everything. Every crunch of bone and spray of blood, and I'll make sure the people of Oxboro hear it all.
Maybe<g id="male_smile" /> with a few small embellishments, if you catch my meaning.
Return to Oxboro
There you are, my bear-hunting friend! Up for another round?
Polly, my sweet Polly. I've failed you for the last time. All I wanted was to see you smile again, but I can barely muster a smile for myself.
Leave me be. What's the point in dragging myself down the road?
It'll be the same no matter what I do. Thieves, pirates, and murderers without a scrap of mercy for a poor soul.
Hope in a Bottle
The Lost Pirates of the Riverworn Grotto have stolen Jacob Evans' last shipment of mead, driving him to the brink of despair.
"Are you giving up?"
I should. I would, if not for dear Polly. Her business depends on the mead that I bring, but I'm just a porter.
I can't stop those wretched pirates from taking everything and stabbing me through. I've lost count...
"I'll get your mead."
Hope's cruel on Aeternum, stranger. If you don't learn that now, you will soon.
Go, do whatever folly strikes your fancy. Maybe I'll still be here when you return.
Polly deserves better than me. Someone strong, brave, and true of heart.
My… mead? I can't believe my eyes.
I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. I really did think you were having a laugh at me earlier. But you meant every word you said.
Travel to {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect Mead from chests
Since you seem to have a shred of kindness, I thought maybe… you could find my missing wine shipment?
It was stolen weeks ago. Probably gone or drunk now, but I thought I'd ask.
No Time for Wine
With his mead returned, Jacob Evans turns his attention to his next source of woe: a shipment of missing wine.
"This happens to you often?"
Look at me, friend. A lonely man with his wits barely about him, marching from one town to the next on his own two legs.
I'm an easy target no matter how careful I am, or which road I take.
Please, if you can't find the wine, just… leave me to my fate. The mead's not enough to save Polly's bar. Nothing I do is ever enough.
Oh my… That's almost every missing bottle. I don't know what to say.
I haven't much to repay you, not after what you've done for me.
"It was just some wine."
Humph. Only some wine to you. To me, it's hope! To my dear Polly, a chance to keep her head above water.
God, it hurts to hope after so long. Like putting a chilled hand too close to the flame.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
I remember a face, and a laugh crueler than the Devil's. Admiral Arias, at the Arias Encampment.
He was the first to come after me on the road. I hear he's Lost now, but it's a cold comfort.
Master and Commandaria
Jacob Evans has remembered the name of one of his tormentors. Help him get some revenge on Admiral Arias.
"What did he take from you?"
This time, it's not about my goods. Someone ought to teach him a lesson.
He's a coward, preying on decent folk who can't fight back. But he won't expect anybody to march up and thrash him.
"I'm looking forward to it."
Don't be rash, friend. If something happened to such a charitable soul because of me…
No, no, you gave me hope, and I'll have faith in you. Godspeed!
What do the Lost want with my wares? Can they even taste the sweetness of mead?
Um… Let me see the label on that old bottle. It's covered in dust, but this writing… could it be?
Ha ha ha ha ha ha... It is! The wine of kings, the king of wines, the Commandaria of Cyprus! The knights Templar once sold this wine.
"You're actually smiling."
Ha ha. Smiling? My friend, I could dance for joy! This is a vintage only grown on the island of Cyprus.
There's nothing like it on Aeternum, no substitute. The nobles would sell the very clothes off their backs for a mere sip!
Travel to {POITags}
Collect Sake Bottles
Defeat {targetName}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect Dusty Bottle
I dare not risk so valuable a vintage. If I tried to carry it, with my luck? Something terrible would happen.
Can you bring this priceless treasure to Polly? By itself, it'll erase all her debts!
Raising the Bar
Jacob is entrusting you with delivering the priceless bottle of Commandaria to Polly's bar, in the hopes that it will save her business.
"You're sure?"
Certain. I would love to deliver it myself, but I'm content knowing Polly's saved.
Be careful. Don't wave that bottle around, or anyone who knows its value will be after your blood.
Polly's livelihood depends on that bottle. Wrap it up, and make sure the label's covered.
What's all this, now? A bottle of wine? I didn't order this. It's a generous gift, but what's all this about?
"Jacob sent it."
Jacob? Jacob Evans? Good gracious, that poor kind man.
He's suffered so, yet he still thinks of me and my humble little establishment.
Let's see what we have here. Commandaria? From the island of Cyprus?
This is enough to save my bar, and then some! I could even buy a nice little cottage with what's left over.
Talk to Polly the Everfall Barkeep
Polly's saved, my wares are restored, and Admiral Arias hasn't been scouring the roads of late.
All of this may seem a small kindness to you, friend. But to me, it meant everything.
I've been toying with the idea of renaming my bar. Perhaps after that fortuitous bottle of Commandaria.
Or maybe after you, {playerName}? How'd you like your name on a pretty painted sign?
You're looking a bit peaky, traveler. Whether it's a stiff leg, sore head, or the simple ennui of life, Anwir Hughes has an elixir for you!
Twenty coin, only twenty coin for a bottle of Anwir's Elixir. Thirty-five for two, even cheaper for repeat customers.
You, there! How would you like to feel younger, stronger, and better looking today?
Cure For What Ails You
The wares that Anwir is hawking seem a little suspect. Nevertheless, he's happy to pay for help "improving" them.
"That sounds unlikely."
Shh! Not so loud! Are you trying to bring the guards down on my head?
Listen, a man has to make a living. And it's all harmless, I promise. I wouldn't sell anything that would hurt a fly.
"Why should I believe you?"
I'll let you in on how I brew the elixir. You can see for yourself.
Just need a nice, solid ram horn and a fresh liver. Come now, it’s not too much to ask, and you can even have a tidy share of my profits.
I need a better name for the product. Anwir's Elixir just doesn't sound impressive enough.
A fine piece of liver and a perfect ram's horn. You sure you haven't done this before?
Now, we shave off a bit of the horn, grind up some liver, and there it is. A healthy addition to Anwir's Ancient Miracle Elixir.
"That's disgusting."
My great-aunt always said liver was good for you. Though I admit, you're right about the smell.
It could use some work. Nobody wants to buy an elixir that smells foul.
Search the wilds for cougars and rams
Harvest a Mature Ram's Horn
Harvest a Fat Cougar Liver
Meet Anwir Hughes near the Covenant Enclave
Ahh, the irreplaceable smell of nature. It always puts pep in my step and makes me feel young again.
If I could find a way to bottle that scent, I'd make a fortune!
My perceptive friend, fancy meeting you again. Do you remember my Ancient Miracle Elixir?
The Secret Ingredient
Anwir Hughes is back, with another scheme to "improve" his Ancient Miracle Elixir.
"The disgusting one? Yes."
You wound me! Yes, the latest version of the elixir was pungent, but I know how to solve that little problem.
Hydrangeas.They were my grandfather's favorite blossom. They'll do the trick, I just know it.
Unfortunately, we'll need many flowers for just one bottle of elixir.
Such lovely hydrangeas. You, my friend, have a knack for spotting good potion ingredients.
Look, they even improve the elixir's color, not just the scent. I think we have gold in a bottle here.
Explore Nettlerest Graveyard for Anwir's secret ingredient
Harvest Hydrangeas
Finally, we reach my favorite part. Distributing free samples to needy townsfolk.
Once they've had a taste, they'll be throwing coin at me for more! Do let me know how it goes.
Potions for the People
Nothing can go wrong with distributing Anwir's Ancient Miracle Elixir to the people of Everfall, right?
"Why am I handing out samples?"
Who better than you? You've got that heroic look, and you radiate a certain aura of… trustworthiness.
It's a gift that not all of us have. Especially not me.
If you get cold feet, just remember: there's coin in it for you too.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />We have new cause for hope in you, my friend. And I am now spreading the word.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />The man's mostly harmless, but if I have to listen to you read one of his sales pitches, you can keep walking.
"And a sample from Hughes."
<g id="male_why" />Hey! Keep your nose out of trouble, traveler. I do not need another problem on my plate.
<g id="male_smile" />Well, now. My legs don't feel as stiff. I never thought I'd see the day Anwir Hughes turned over a new leaf.
Any packages meant for the household can be given to me. What's this? Anwir's Ancient Miracle Elixir? What a bizarre name.
"You're welcome to try it."
The label says it cures all aches, ailments, and heartaches? How could a potion cure heartache?
Mmm, I do feel less tense after a few sips. That's a pleasant surprise in these trying times. Thank you.
What's that<g id="male_complimentplayer" /> you're holding? I could use a good strong brew before me next hunt.
"Better. A miracle elixir."
Let me guess,<g id="male_smile" /> one of Anwir's? Don't look surprised, I've lived in Everfall at least as long as that old rascal.
<g id="male_chuckle" />Well, nothing from Anwir's killed me yet. Bottoms up, and give him my regards, will you?
As of today, I've sold at least a dozen orders of Anwir's Ancient Miracle Elixir. They're going faster than I can make them!
And of course, I would never forget to pay my best friend in this endeavor.
"The elixir worked, for some."
Of course it did. Hope is more potent than any potion.
Though we live forever, ailment, despair, and darkness still plague us. <g id="male_explain" />Sometimes, all we need to step back from the brink is a small sip of hope.
Deliver Anwir's potions to the citizens of Oxboro
Offer potions to Captain Dubois
Offer potions to Atticus Delphi
Offer potions to Odnell Lee
What next? Anwir's Ancient Miracle Elixir is all very well and good, but customers crave novelty.
Crystals and gemstones, perhaps? Everybody loves a big, sparkling rock.
[The writing on this parchment is barely legible and covered in suspicious dark stains.]
What is it? There is no rest for those who seek the universe's mysteries.
[By picking up the paper and holding it up to the light, you can see a few lines of text.]
"Superiora de inferioribus, inferiora de superioribus."
Bottle It Up
Try to piece together the strange alchemical recipe, then bring it to a Syndicate alchemist for further study.
"Some sort of alchemical recipe?"
[You carefully copy down the legible text from the paper fragment, but it's meaningless on its own. You need more information to make sense of it.]
x
[By itself, this scrap of paper is useless to you. The glass bottles scattered around it may contain some clues.]
x
Hm? What's that you've got? "Superiora de inferioribus, inferiora de superioribus."
Do you have any idea what you've found? This recipe may reveal the very nature of the cosmos to us!
"That sounds unlikely."
I would not expect the casual observer to recognize the import of Hugo of Santalla's writings.
Hmm… From what I can discern, this potion should "call down cosmic starlight" upon its imbiber. Here you are.
Travel to {POITags}
Collect Alchemy Bottles
Call down the starlight. Hah, all that for a silly parlor trick!
Despite my disappointment, this recipe was a valuable find. A sharp reminder that the mysterious infinite laughs at our puny efforts.
[The paper fragment is already crumbling to pieces. Soon, there will be nothing left of it.]
I am afraid I have little time for casual conversation, stranger. My proprietor keeps my hands busy at all times.
You must<g id="female_headnodding" /> be new to town. I would remember a face like yours.
If you<g id="female_touchhands" /> come across any interesting gossip, do be sure to let me know. I might have a favor to offer in exchange.
Do I know you? Hmph. Whatever your business, you should speak to my manservant, Atticus. I am terribly busy, you see.
How curious. You approach unannounced and unaccompanied. Perhaps you do not understand basic etiquette.
Ignorance deserves patience, but I caution you against such impropriety in the future. I bid you farewell.

string.comment: "Hmms" are hummed notes of music. Talking to himself, then immediately becoming more polite as he addresses the player.
string.speaker: Atticus Delphi
string.name: AtticusDelphi

resources.string: Hmm, hmm hmm… No, more lilting. Perhaps with a key change. No, let it breathe. Oh! You caught me unawares. How may I be of assistance?
The Magnum Opus
Longing to rise above his station as a butler, Atticus Delphi wishes to share his musical talents with the world. With so many instruments to choose from, he is struck with a moment of indecision.
"Sorry, you were humming?"
Alas, I should have chosen a more private locale for this.
Could you kindly forget what you saw and heard? My mistress would be quite irate, if she learned I've been sneaking away to work on such a frivolous pursuit.
"Humming a tune?"
If only my duty to my mistress did not prevent it. To be free of her, I must earn another patron.
To complete my greatest work, I first need to hear it aloud. Which means, I must select an instrument! Can you play?
"I can carry a tune."
Excellent. I have a guitar in my possession, but there may be a more fitting instrument for my work.
The townsfolk have instruments we can borrow. Would you be so kind as to procure a handful, and play them for me?
A guitar may very well be suitable, but I will know the true voice of my work when I hear it.
<g id="male_smile" />A fine day, is it not? The autumnal splendor of Everfall is always on full display.
<g id="male_compliment" />Stay awhile, enjoy the scenery, and be sure to buy a drink at the tavern!
"Do you have an instrument?"
<g id="male_compliment" />Well now, that is a MOST curious request. Are you a lover of music? An artisan, perhaps?
<g id="male_patience" />It so happens that I carry a flute, should I be in a musical mood. As long as you solemnly swear to return it, you may borrow it.
Procure Instruments:
<g id="female_explainS" />Have you come to report a crime? I believe my guard captain, Franc, is better suited to handle the situation.
"Can I borrow that upright bass?"
<g id="female_headnodding" />It is quite heavy. I would hate for you to hurt yourself... But I suppose the moon and planets are aligned in a way that suggests better luck.
<g id="female_explainS" />Hmm. Yes. You may. Return it in a timely manner, please.
Ahhh… there it is. The flute produces the most whimsical sound. I can elicit soul-stirring melodies from such an instrument.
Yes, this will do nicely. You hold onto it, for now. We will return it later, along with the rest.
Borrow Atticus' Guitar
Ask to borrow an instrument from Magistrate Clark
Ask to borrow an instrument from Constable Maecia
Borrow the Upright Bass
Search the tavern for an instrument
Borrow the Mandolin
Return to Atticus Delphi
Play A Song on Each Instrument:
Play the Mandolin
Play the Guitar
Play the Upright Bass
Play the Flute
I must ask your patience while I compose. My process can be a lengthy one, and I wish to do so in solitude.
<g id="female_explainS" />I heard you thrumming and twanging from over here. I did not know you could play.
<g id="female_nodYes" />That skill may very well come in handy in this town.
Ah! There you are. My magnum opus is complete! <g id="male_spreadarms001" />I shall call it… Winds of Autumn!
Now I must ensure it is heard far and wide. <g id="male_headShakeNo" />Without popular excitement, I will never gain the favor of a suitable patron.
Reputation is Everything
What good is a composition if it goes unheard? Play the Magnum Opus throughout the town in a grand debut as a composer!
"Where will you play?"
I cannot be the one to deliver my work unto the world. To gain a reputation for being a GREAT composer, we must create the impression that my music has spread far and wide.
In this business, as in many others, reputation is everything.
"So this is where I come in."
Very astute! I would like you to play the part of a traveling bard. Find individuals of influence throughout the town and play my melody before them.
Ensure that you mention my pen name: Composer Marsyas.
If you want to embellish a little, perhaps you could also mention how prolific my work is.
<g id="male_smile" />I see you have my flute! Do you mean to awe me with a song?
<g id="male_compliment" />I will always make time for pleasant music. It gives me great joy. Do proceed.
<g id="male_headNodYes" />My, my, my! To whom do I owe this wondrous experience?
"A composer named Marsyas."
<g id="female_taptemple" />I will remember that name. Do convey my appreciation for this work, should you meet again.
<g id="female_beckonLarger" />You simply must share this with Captain Dubois. You will find him near the Governor's hall. Oh, and keep the flute.<g id="female_salute2finger" /> My treat.

<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />I overheard a melody floating on the wind. <g id="male_quidproquo" />I confess, I am not much for the arts myself. My hands can do little more than bear a weapon, but I can appreciate mastery when I hear it.
<g id="male_convince01" />Will you play it again for me?
<g id="male_applaud" />It is even more stirring with you before me.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />Where did you come by this song? Did you compose it?
"I learned from Marsyas."
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />They must be prolific indeed, if their work can stand out so in a city like ours.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Constable Maecia will want to hear this.<g id="male_explain" /> She takes delight in introducing rising talent to the gentry. Many consider it a favor.
<g id="male_listenforward" priority="high" />Was that the lilting of a flute I heard? Yes, I do have a sharp ear.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />If your work is of such quality, I know several individuals who would be delighted to learn your name. <g id="male_convince02" />Play for me?
<g id="female_headnodding" />Yes. Yes, this is exactly what this town needs. <g id="female_salute2finger" />I shall ensure your name is spoken far and wide.
<g id="female_flirtSmall" />When you earn yourself a patron, do remember who helped grow your career!
"Marsyas is the composer, not me."
<g id="female_applause" />Ah! A bard, then! How kind of you to bring this melody to us! I shall ensure that Marsyas receives proper recognition. Do be sure to inform them of my generosity!
<g id="female_headnodding" />Now, you must play for the masses! To the tavern with you!
A bard? Good. I could use someone to liven up the place a bit.
Take your place by the fire, love.
Oh. A shame the usual crowd wasn't here to enjoy that, but I'll be singing your praises.
I hope you can come back and play another night.
"I'll let composer Marsyas know."
Is that their name? I'll be sure to ask other bards if they know any of Marsyas's songs.
I appreciate you breaking up the quiet with that bit of joy.
How did it go? Did they like it? Did their eyes shine? Perhaps shed a tear?
I wish I could have seen their reactions for myself, but there are more important things. <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Did it make an impact? Is there now a reputation I must uphold?
"I'd say so. They loved the song."
What a relief. Even though I find great joy in composing, there is always a moment where I fear I am simply a butler, and nothing more.
I will approach Mistress Sacco now, I think. Maybe she will offer to sponsor my music!
Practice 'Winds of Autumn'
Approach the Magistrate
Play for the Magistrate
Brag about Atticus
Approach the Guard Captain
Play for the Guard Captain
Brag about Atticus
Approach the Constable
Play for the Constable
Brag about Atticus
Approach the Barkeeper
Play for the Tavern
Brag about Atticus
I hope we have done enough to spread my fame. Without that reputation, I fear I will never earn a proper patron.
My duty to my Mistress is wearing me thin.
My, my.<g id="female_applause" /> Whoever is this "Composer Marsyas?" I would put good money on that being a pen name.
Now, I<g id="female_thinking" /> must know someone who's been dabbling in music of late…?
Constable Maecia alerted me to a new force in the music world. One Composer Marsyas, I am told.
I am determined to learn more. Perhaps their work may be auspicious enough to earn my backing.
Again, you approach without prior arrangement. I am beginning to view this as impertinence, stranger.
Composer Marsyas indeed. Oh, I have never been more affronted in my LIFE!
You tell that deceitful manservant that he is lucky to remain in my employ!
This is terrible, my friend. I heard that my Mistress was interested in backing my pen name and revealed to her that it was me. I had expected…
At any rate… my pay has been docked, and I am not to speak of it again.
It's Who You Know
With his reputation growing with each passing day, now is the time to seek a patron. One does not simply approach the patriarch of a great house on a whim, however…
"Harsh. What are you going to do?"
Find a patron without her, obviously. She does not own me.
I did some sleuthing and discovered that the Ou family recently lost a musician in their employ. If we tread carefully, I can present myself to the patriarch.
"How do you get an audience?"
One never approaches a noble personage without an introduction. There are only a handful of people who can arrange one. We need to find out who they are.
Start with their maid, Saira. She always has her ear to the ground.
There are other avenues, but they are less socially acceptable.
You got<g id="female_impatient" priority="high" /> that look on your face. You know the one. Preparing to ask for something that's above your station, hm? Well, get on with it.
"Can I meet with your employer?"
Lord Shen<g id="female_explains" /> is particular about his company. You might be a bit too… dusty… to garner the right kind of attention.
Luckily, Atticus<g id="female_headnodding" /> is not. Don't act surprised, I know what you're after. I can help you both, for a price. In fact, I have a list.
Do you<g id="female_explains" /> have the items I requested? Hand them over, and I'll evaluate how you've done.
"I've taken care of your errands."
And I<g id="female_headnodding" /> trust the parcel was delivered to the correct address. Good.
A courier<g id="female_explains" /> will seek out Atticus with an invitation. He is not to be late. He must be well-dressed and carry himself as a musician, not a butler. Understood?
I detect triumph in your demeanor. I do not know what you had to do to secure this opportunity for me, but I suspect victory is close at hand.
And now, we wait.
Speak to the Ou Family maid
Run errands for Saira Yangandul
Finish Saira's laundry
Collect a parcel
Drop off the parcel
Repair the Broken Pocket Watch at a Workshop
Report back to Saira Yangandul
Saira winked at me as I walked past. She knows something, and she seems very smug about it.
I confess, I am having difficulty containing my eagerness.
You best<g id="female_headnodding" /> believe I am going to dangle that little favor over Atticus for a good while yet.
Thank you<g id="female_headnodding" /> for your part in this, it really made my day.
Your name has been mentioned, although I have already forgotten it. As you are known to my associates, I shall not call for a guard.
Leave me. I will summon you when I wish to speak again. I hope we understand one another.
Look at this… the embossed wax seal, the heft of the paper… even the ink is gilt in gold. Every detail screams affluence, and yet it is hardly overt.
This letter summons me to Lord Shen's side.
Everyone has a Price
The great family Sacco will not be humiliated so easily. With Atticus bound to his contractual duties, his patron may be the only one who can set him free to practice his craft.
"Congratulations!"
Thank you… my heart is all aflutter. Perhaps you could act as my associate and accompany me?
I know this may be beneath you, but think of how it will reflect on the reputation we worked so hard to build!
I am so nervous I could sweat through my socks. How humiliating would that be?
Marsyas, or should I say Atticus, has told me a great deal about you. It seems I have you to thank for this auspicious meeting.
I have decided to grant Atticus my esteemed patronage, but it comes with a condition.
"And what might that be?"
I cannot employ one who is already sworn to another. I must come to an acceptable arrangement with Lady Sacco.
It would wound her pride to surrender him to me, but I suppose that is the point. Ask her to name her price.
I knew it! It was you who spread those ridiculous rumors.
You filled my darling Atticus' head with flights of fancy, and now look! He seeks to exit my employ!
"Lord Shen wishes to negotiate."
He would. He knows what it would mean for him to woo my manservant. How it would stain the family name!
He does it for his own pride, not for Atticus' sake. No. I will accept no offer!
Well? What is her price? I have deep pockets, after all, but I am sure she will not part with him easily.
"She refused to part with him."
How amusing. She thinks herself above temptation. Well, I can see that corrected.
I prepared an initial offering. Deliver it to her, if you would. And do not open it, or I shall have your head.
Are you intentionally trying to waste my time?
I told you! I will not part with my dear Atticus. Nothing from Lord Shen could possibly change my mind!
"Lord Shen sent me with this."
Let me see it. Oh… oh, my. How grand. How generous. Perhaps he is not the fiend I thought.
He has such lovely taste in parchment. What a lovely texture. With great regret and sorrow, I do accept his offer.
You return. Well? Shall I deliver the good news to Atticus?
"What did you offer her?"
Impertinent, but I am in a pleasant mood. I will divulge.
I gave her a handsome estate in Windsward and her pick of personal attendants. A balm to her wounded pride, and I can dismiss one of my more irksome charges.
Attend an audience with Lord Shen
Speak to Lord Shen
Ask Lady Sacco for her terms
Relay her response to Lord Shen
Return to Lady Sacco with the offer
Oh, I cannot bear the thought of facing Lady Sacco myself. Lord Shen reassured me that there would be no need.
What if she chooses not to part with me? Will she truly stoop to quashing my life's ambition?
Thank you, my dear friend. Our mutual efforts have succeeded. I stand poised on the precipice of greatness, with my patron at my back.
Rest assured, I will not forget your part in this. I shall see your name praised.
Now that<g id="female_headnodding" /> Atticus is a member of our household, I get to hold my favor over him all I want. Delightful. I love watching him squirm.
And I<g id="female_headnodding" /> suppose I should thank you, for the amusement of it all.
You have done well to bring this composer to my attention. He will represent my house well, and I shall take pride in being his patron.
We are no longer on speaking terms. Begone.

string.comment: The old line hasn't been replaced with this new one
string.speaker: Alchemist Olivera
string.name: AlchemistOlivera

resources.string: I’m with the Syndicate, the true inheritors of the Ancients' legacy.

string.comment: The old line hasn't been replaced with this new one
string.speaker: Alchemist Olivera
string.name: AlchemistOlivera

resources.string: We are committed to harnessing the power of Azoth and ushering in a new and never-ending age of enlightenment for all.

string.comment: The old line hasn't been replaced with this new one
string.speaker: Adjudicator Amano
string.name: AdjudicatorAmano

resources.string: We are the Covenant. We are driven to protect this place, defend the helpless, and administer justice.

string.comment: The old line hasn't been replaced with this new one
string.speaker: Adjudicator Amano
string.name: AdjudicatorAmano

resources.string: I serve as the Adjudicator for this settlement.
[Mired in mud, the owner of this cart is nowhere to be seen. Nothing remains of their cargo save some dusty paper and scraps of stone.]
x
Miner's Keepers
One ill-fated miner's find is another better-fated miner's treasure.

Thank you for visiting, but now's not a good time. Be careful when you go - don't slip on that loose board out there!
I'd call a town meeting, but I worry my misfortune is contagious. We need an expert on this Corruption business… and someone to boost defenses. It's… overwhelming.
I should just stay here and mind my own business. It's safer for everyone that way.
From now on, anytime you like, visit me or the Town Board. You can take any tasks that suit your fancy.
This Corruption business gets thicker and more ominous by the minute. People have been reporting gobs of that crimson evil popping up everywhere, closer and closer to the setttlement.
I hope that crazy old man knows something that can turn the tide around here. If not, we'll all be walking around, red eyes and raving lunatics before you know it.
Ah, look what the mangy old cat dragged in! Cecilia says you helped her make me this lucky charm. That was very kind of you.
I'll tell Magistrate Clark he doesn't have to bear all the burden any more. I'm ready and willing to do my part.
Welcome to Everfall! A finer and safer place you will not find in all of Aeternum!
We must make preparations to secure the settlement. The Corruption will come - it's just a question of when.
If you intend to enlist with another settlement, now is the time. We can certainly use your sword-arm around here, however.
Back in the Old World, I knew for certain that a score of valiant soldiers could defend against any threat. Those days are gone.
You've undoubtedly seen the factions in town - the Marauders, the Syndicate, and the Covenant. Like or not, they are best equipped to defend Everfall.
Despite the general mood around town, I have a good feeling about things.
Surely you've noticed the Towers of the Ancients in our territory. I've often wondered what secrets they might contain.
The Corruption is most undoubtedly spreading across Aeternum right now. We must find a way to keep it outside our walls.
If you want to engage in idle chit-chat, I suggest you visit the barkeep.
I understand you've been working with Maecia. She is a… unique leader, is she not?
You can take that blade, or anything else you forge to the trading post. The Magistrate will make purchases for the arsenal.
Survivalist Lee, or 'Fancypants,' as I call him, is an egotistical brute. And I find his fashion sense wanting.
Unfortunately, it's difficult to get any work done around that nettlesome Survivalist. I suggest you avoid him at all cost.
Have you spoken to Survivalist Lee? He hasn't said a word to me in some time.
You know, I never would have guessed it, but my brooch matches Odnell's pants quite well, I think.
Storms buffeting the shores, the shattered mountain spewing Corruption, and breaches opening up in our own backyard! Exciting times, my friend!
Question for you is, what'll you do if this all comes crashing down? You better know how to survive on your own.
You remind me that sometimes I need a break from settlement life. Nothing like running through the woods with nothing but your pants on, you know?
Now here comes a proud warrior if ever I've seen one! If you're looking to knock some skulls around, you've come to the right place!
I swear, I don't know what the woman has against me. Am I just too damn sexy for her because of the way I dress?
Now here comes a proud warrior if ever I've seen one! If you're looking to knock some skulls around, you've come to the right place!
Sometimes good things happen only when you give up and stop forcing them to be that way.
Oh hello there! You are most welcome to the Everfall tavern. Sit down, imbibe, take a moment to enjoy life.
Hello! Are you new in town? I think you must be. That's good, you know. Fresh faces, confidence.
Can you believe it? Constable Maecia actually came down and drank an ale with me earlier. You and I - we made a difference!
Yes. I can see that you're new to Aeternum. Strong arms though - a warrior. Probably some heads for you to bop somewhere then. Good day!
I already know what Magistrate Clark hopes for - my help in defending against the Corruption. I just have to decide whether that interests me.
You know, we're capable of doing great things together. Your brawn, my brain. Nothing can stop us.
I've been waiting for you some time, you know. Quite a compliment, I should say.
This is truly groundbreaking work we're accomplishing here. Stay at my side, and the power of the stars will soon be at our disposal.
It all makes sense now. The towers, the stars, the guardians. The question is simply - what changed?
Now, if I can just figure out how to activate this sphere. It won't take long! Not for me!
Now, if I can just figure out how to activate this sphere. It won't take long! Not for me!
I’m with the Syndicate, the true inheritors of The Ancients legacy. We are committed to harnessing the power of Azoth and ushering in a new and never-ending age of enlightenment for all.
Are you here to seek knowledge? Then this is proof you have wisdom.
Observe the other Faction Leaders and you will come to understand that your path is with the Syndicate.
I see that inquisitive sparkle in your eye. It is the same with us all. Knowledge stands above all things - that is our code.
Strength untempered by reason leads to nothing but ruin. Alas, you will learn this soon enough.
You zealots see faith as a virtue. But what is faith if not belief without evidence? In other words, madness.
Now that you are one of us, you will have access to vast knowledge… in time. But first, I have a challenge for you.
I greet you in reverence, fellow pursuer of knowledge.
We are the Covenant. We are charged by divine decree to protect this place and administer justice. I serve as the Adjudicator for this settlement.
I am here on behalf of the Covenant seeking those who are similarly inspired.
Learn of the other factions to understand their folly. Return to me to find salvation by joining the Covenant.
Do I see the spark of righteousness in this one? In a world beset by darkness, we are the light.
Oh great Marauder, always in such a rush to act. Yet so blind to the suffering such methods beget. May your Spark burn steadfastly, and illuminate a new truth in you.
So great must be the burden of knowing all the world's truths! Have you come to educate such a wretch as me?
We cannot stand by and watch others suffer. That is why I must make one request of you.
The light of the Covenant shines within you.
You look strong, friend. You should consider joining the Marauders. We will put that strength to use.
Who's brave enough to approach the Marauder Commander?
I challenge you to meet with the other Factions. Then you will understand that we Marauders are the strongest.
You look strong, friend. You should consider joining the Marauders. We will put that strength to use.
And here we have a member of the Syndicate. I suggest you stay with your nose in those books. Leave the fighting to us.
I’m fine on my own, thank you very much. A Marauder needs help from no Covenant.
A Marauder salivates at the prospect of battle. This mission is not a test, but a reward.
I salute you, fellow Marauder. We will never give up the fight, and in the end, we will emerge victorious.
Welcome to 'The Autumn Rest'! Always a colorful place to be. You here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
You've become a real regular around here, haven't you? Hope this place is starting to feel like home. Say though, are you more of a townie? Or do you venture out into the great beyond?
Now that you caught a glimpse of Windsward, I trust you see why Everfall is a damn nice place. The Autumn Rest is the place you can fall like a leaf into your bed anytime!
One of these days I'm going to take a vacation, maybe even go as far south as First Light. I've been squirreling away Azoth and gold for years. I've earned a vacation, I think.
You know, I'm never one to turn away a good paying customer. But you been here long enough - might want to look into buying a house, putting down roots.

You look like a smart individual. I bet you'd love to make yourself rich, like me. I tell you, corner the market on iron. You can't go wrong, everyone needs iron! It's just like gold, only more useful in the long run.

Here for more tips? I knew you’d be back. Look. Forget iron, orichalcum is where it’s at! Buy now, sell high later, you won't regret it! It's how you can save up for three houses. I should know, it's how I saved up for mine!
One day, my fine friend, one day you shall be strong enough to participate in a glorious spectacle! Keep training, and return to me when you have a want to prove yourself in combat with allies.
Step right up, step right up, for a showdown you will never forget! Two teams enter, and after a clash of skill and brutality a team emerges victorious!
Are you courageous enough to brave… the Arena?
Two teams enter, and after a clash of skill and brutality a team emerges victorious! Are you courageous enough to brave… the Arena?
There's my champion! Up for another bout? You can return anytime to the glory and spectacle that is... the Arena!
I’ll dredge up a few more challengers…
Win an Arena Match to prove your valor
Placeholder Task Text
"What's so special about it?"

The joy of speculation! The ups and downs of the market! The thrill of finding out how much solvent is worth today! Trade is the lifeblood of Aeternum, if you don't have your finger on its pulse, you just aren't living!
"Have any trading tips?"

Buy low, sell high. If at all possible discover what people want before they want it and buy it all up, thus creating a shortage in the market that only you can fill. That one's a bit trickier though...
"You own three houses?"

Dare I say three is not enough? I long for a house in every territory, so that my trading empire can flourish to its fullest extent, but I have been told time and again that I simply must abide by the current laws…
Visit a Convergence Holiday Hut
Gather a Lost Present from around Aeternum, or investigate the site mentioned by the Winter Wanderer
Gather a fallen Gleamite Crystal from a Gleamite Shower at night, or investigate the site mentioned by the Winter Wanderer
Locate and put an end to the Winter Warrior's Forever Winter in Great Cleave, Ebonscale Reach, or Brimstone Sands and retrieve his Hailspikes as proof of victory
Gleamite Shard
Lost Present
Winter Convergence is upon us. You lack the strength of heart to be able to assist me, but if you come back stronger, I have a request for you.
The Yearly Convergence
Welcome to the Winter Convergence! Check out the Holiday Huts in the Winter Villages to see what items can be crafted there.
Once again we see the two sides of winter converging: the warmth of kinship and the bitter cold of ice.
Imagine Aeternum, covered in rime and frost in every corner… This could be our fate in the Forever Winter.
"How do we avoid that fate?"
We must chase away cold. First, by warming hearts. {playerName}, are you prepared to do whatever it takes to save Aeternum?
"What will it take, exactly?"
Make yourself at ease in this village. Remember what you fight for. Holiday Huts will have shiny coins to give warmth to island.
Village here has huts. Huts have shiny coins. Trade coins for goods. Many, many goods! They will help your journey.
This year has much waiting for you if you bring warmth back to Aeternum. Winter, cold, and eternal darkness can be held back by you.
Lost Presents
Find one of the many Lost Presents around Aeternum and return it to the Winter Wanderer in the Winter Village.
Yeti use winter magic to spread ice and snow. This ice comes alive, steals presents from humans.
Without joy, how will we fight off Forever Winter?
"How do we spread joy?"
Collect presents taken by other Yeti and their ice creatures. Devious minds scatter presents all over the island.
"Why do they steal presents?"
Winter Warrior, one of dread, commands it so. Warrior does all he can to usher in Forever Winter. Must be stopped.
Have you found wayward presents? Some suspend in air, locked into place by winter magics.
This gift… makes me remember… I was lost on a mountain, in a terrible winter storm.
A bright star led me into a cave. When I came out the other side, I was here in Aeternum.
The Power of Gleamite
Mine a fallen Gleamite Crystal and return it to the Winter Wanderer in the Winter Village.
Many ways to get to Aeternum, but no way out.
At least here we have Gleamite Crystals. They radiate warmth without burning, and are the bane of the Winter Warrior.
"Why does the Warrior hate them?"
Tinkling, ringing with the sound of laughter are these crystals. Their heat harms the Winter Warrior as they fall from the sky to light the land.
"Where do they fall from?"
I do not know. Heavens? Clouds? Who is to say? All that is important is gathering crystals to weaken Warrior's grip on island.
I have marked on your map where a Gleamite Crystal can be found.
Thank you, {playerName}. You have done much, but I am afraid I must ask for more help still. The Winter Warrior must fall.
Forever Winter
Locate the Winter Warrior's spread of the Forever Winter and collect his Hailspikes as proof of victory against the chiling threat.
Each time Warrior is brought down he is weaker.
The weaker the Warrior is, the better for Aeternum. This I know from my Mirgos memories, my human memories you helped bring back.
"Was the Warrior human once, too?"
Perhaps. Do not fret. Beast or man, The Winter Warrior must be taken down. Are you willing to accept the challenge?
"Where can I find him?"
Ice magics allow for Warrior to travel this year.
You will know him by icy winds and massive spikes. Bring one back to me so heart can be put to ease.
The Winter Warrior is formidable foe. Take friends, allies, and all you can to defeat him.
He is defeated! Oh joy, oh beautiful day! A peaceful Convergence is possible now. Should he appear again, you know what to do.
Your triumph over Winter Warrior keeps back the fate of Forever Winter.
Save presents, mine Gleamite Crystals, and challenge Warrior for the sake of warmth, light, and all that is good.
Enter The Arena
Maximus Marcellus invites you to participate in a team versus team extravaganza. \nUse the Activities Menu to queue for a match
"What is the Arena?"

What is the Arena? Why, it is in the grand tradition of my motherland of Rome, it is a battle spectacular of two teams going head-to-head in combat! It requires skill, coordination, and an unshakable mettle to participate.
"How do I participate?"
You can sign up for the Arena grounds whenever you like, fight head-to-head for everlasting glory! \n[Use the Activities Menu to queue for a 3v3 match]
What are you waiting for? Get out there and pummel! [Use the Activities Menu to queue for a 3v3 match]
What a show! I was on the edge of my seat the entire time! You, my friend, are a sure addition to the Arena roster. Return to fight any time, you are always welcome here my fearsome champion!
Enter the Arena via 'Activities' in the Menu
Tenacious Rose
Mysterious Raiders have taken over the ruins of Stonereach Keep where Abigail Rose was living. She's asked you to help figure who they are, why they're here and how she can get rid of them.
"Whoa, easy! You seem a bit jumpy."
Out here, that's a critical trait, lest you wind up Corrupted or Lost!
And don't try to tell me a settlement would be safer! I'll not be trusting my fate to some bumbling constable!
"You're living out here instead?"
I am… or at least, I was! The keep up the road - Stonereach - was my home until these swine-loving soldiers showed up!
Don’t recognize their banners. Don't know who they are or why they're here, but I want them out!
“Anything I can do to help?”
A mercenary, are you? I knew it. Fine, go to the keep and learn what you can. Feel free to leave none alive.
They’ve got a camp to the west too. I’m headed to scout that out. Meet me there when you’ve dealt with these louts.
Have you figured out what these trespassers are doing in my Keep? Whatever it takes to get rid of them, I'm up for it.
Ah, you dealt that laughing bastard a thrashing? Well done! The wolves finally met a more vicious wolf!
This doesn’t mean I trust you, by the way. But I can’t argue with your results. Did you learn why they're here?
“These orders have some clues.”
Hmmph! Let's see… ‘Varangians,’ eh? Never heard of them. Not much to work with here, but I didn't expect much anyways.
Backup plan, I'll surround the Keep with enough traps so those bastards regret they ever came here. Heh!
Visit {POITags} and Confront the Raiders' Leader

Albert,
Your visions proved true! Raiders have arrived with dread purpose. These ‘Varangians’ seek something - I know not what! 

The tortured cries of their prisoners and their leader’s vicious cackle were horrific. These are monstrous brutes!
They spotted me and I fled, fearing for my very soul. I believe I am safe now, but I'm haunted by that cackle Dear God, Albert! I believe these knights are--\n\n(the rest is blotted out with blood)
[BLANK]

What's this we have here? A note from Scout Desdemona? Oh dear, bless her soul... \n\nIt’s as I feared. I dreamed of these ‘Varangians’ sweeping across the southern lands, a wolfpack on the hunt. But who or what is their prey?
“What should we do?”

Not much at the present. With the threat of Corruption dire as it seems, we must focus on that.\n\nBut fear not, I will be gifted with another vision about these Varangians soon enough, and then our course will be clear.

The Lost Scarecrow
Locate Abigail Rose's missing companion, and find any evidence that points to what the Varangian Knights are searching for.
"What are you doing here?"
My partner and I have been watching this camp for some time, and he moved closer to get a better look. Keep hoping for some sign from him, but nothing yet.
View is limited, and the patrols are thick. You... wouldn't be interested in helping me again, would you?
"You want me to find your partner?"
That's part of it, yes. Romac, that damned scarecrow, went down to the camp about four days ago. He's a master of disguise, so he could be hiding in plain sight.
Look for any sign of him. Search for anything that explains what those Varangian bastards are looking for. There's too much focus here for it to just be another camp.
Stick to the shadows, move slowly... and when the time is right, take them down. That's how we'll get these fools off our land.
Thanks for your help. I'm going to rest here, then take the long way back to the south. Don't want to have any other accidental run-ins with those armored cretins.
Much better at staying out of sight than in a brawl. Abigail will be waiting for my report.
Search for Abigail's missing companion among the Varangians in {POITags}

Rotate and Fire the Cannon
Looks like you've found plenty. Activity reports, a personal journal... wait. This says that Romac was captured!
"I'm sending him north to Riverside Keep under heavy guard." Bah, I know where they've taken him... but I have to take this information back.
"I could go after him."
You know... if I had a hundred of you, we could drive these damned Varangians from our shores forever, and make sure they never return. Yes, please, if you could.
I've heard how they treat prisoners. It isn't pretty. And with the island keeping a person alive, that just gives them more time to work... please, hurry.
Another one... what will it be this time? More hot coals? Going to take a finger or a toe?
Wait, you're not one of those Varangians! You've got to help get me out of here!
"Abigail sent me to do just that."
Abigail? Oh, that brilliant woman. Figured it wouldn't take her long to mount a rescue, especially since I've figured out what these brutes are searching for…
Myrddin's workshop! The problem is that I may have given them the way to reach it...
"What do you mean?"
Before I joined the resistance, I was a relic hunter. Traveled all over this island searching for all manner of strange items.
Some time ago, I followed a trail of clues to a cave in Edengrove that I believe was Myrddin's workshop...
"So they tortured it out of you?"
No! Turns out, torture doesn't work so well on me! But I did take extensive notes on my travels, and now the Varangians have those.
But that's a problem for later... Right now, let's get me out of here. If you can bring me my pack, I'll have what I need to break out.
Another one... what will it be this time? More hot coals? Going to take a finger or a toe?
Wait, you're not one of those Varangians! You've got to help me get out of here!
"Abigail sent me to do just that."
Abigail? Oh, that brilliant woman. Figured it wouldn't take her long to mount a rescue, especially since I've figured out what these brutes are searching for…
Myrddin's workshop! The problem is that I may have given them the way to reach it...
"I found the note you left behind."
You did? Well, were you able to track down my journal and deliver it to that wonderful woman, Caoimhe?
"I did, yes."
Ha! There's a thumb in their eye, I'm sure of it. That Sonechka woman at the camp thought she'd solved every problem when she found my journal and the keystone!
Right then, let's get me out of here. If you can bring me my pack, I'll have what I need to break out.
You're back! Didn't have any trouble going through them, did you? Good, good. Were you able to find my pack? I'll need it to crack this cage.
"I have it right here."
Let me just... ha! Exactly this. Now then, I've got the tools, but it'll take a bit of time. I need a distraction. There's a big cannon up on the walls behind me.
Turn it onto the camp, light up some of their tents. Maybe take down their leader, if you're up to it. That should be more than enough to let me escape.

(Read the note)
To the one who finds this: I have been taken by the Varangians, those cretins who seek to unlock the mysteries of Myrddin's experiments.
Given my treatment at their hands, they won't use them for anything good.
(Continue Reading)
I overheard the guards when they thought I was asleep, and they intend to move me north to someplace called Riverside Keep. The leader here, Anton, leaves tomorrow.
He will go south, along with the notes of my travels. Damn me for a fool, but if they follow the trail back, they may locate what I think is Myrddin's true workshop.
(Continue Reading)
You must head south. There is a woman there, Caoimhe, an apprentice to an Antiquarian. She is an ally, and familiar with the magics of the island.
If these bastards have passed anywhere near her, she will know about it and be able to guide you. You must recover my notebook and give it to her.
You must head south. There is a woman there, Caoimhe, an apprentice to an Antiquarian. She is an ally, and familiar with the magics of the island.
Welcome back! Did you find the notebook for Romac? Wait, he wanted me to have it? If this holds the location to Myrddin's true workshop…
This is a valuable - and dangerous - find. I... think I shall keep this from the Antiquarian. I know just where to hide it.
Well met, stranger! I am Caoimhe, apprenticed to Antiquarian Pajitnova to help her with any items of magical nature she might find.
She's been teaching me how to decipher Ancient glyphs, which is useful when you're delving into the ruins of this island.
"This note that led me to you."
Oh, may I? Hm... oh no, this must be from Romac! I've been helping him with those nasty Varangians. I know the group he's talking about…
They are a particularly vicious lot. Here, I'll mark their location on your map.
Well met, stranger! I am Caoimhe, apprenticed to Antiquarian Pajitnova to help her with any items of a magical nature she might find.
She's been teaching me how to decipher Ancient glyphs, which is useful when you're delving into the ruins of this island.
"Romac sent me to find you."
If Romac sent you, then it must be about that nasty group of Varangians that passed by a short time ago.
I've seen others like them before. Here, I'll mark their location on your map.

You finally find a home worth having only to see it ripped away by some trespassing bastards. That is the refrain on this damn island.
Who are you? You have a dangerous look about you. If you think I’ll be easy prey, you’re sadly mistaken. Go ahead - make your move!
Be careful where you step if you're out towards Stonereach Keep again. My snares have a bite to 'em that'll haunt you for the rest of your days.
I beseech anyone finding this note to see it delivered to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement! I fear my scouting mission has failed and my capture by the enemy is imminent.

This island is so strange, yet the magics here are so familiar. I wonder if there are other places in the world that feel the same...

A scrap of paper has been stuffed in the wall, away from the eyes of the Varangians.
